Develop quick thinking and problem-solving skills: Be able to improvise in case of emergencies and think outside the box in a crisis situation.
Prepare for emergencies: Keep a well-stocked, basic emergency kit with food, water, first aid supplies and other essentials in case of need.
Maintain good relationships with your neighbors: In times of crisis, neighbors may be your only source of help. Get to know your neighbors and help each other in times of need.
Build a strong support network: Have a list of trusted family and friends who you know you can rely on for help in case of emergencies.
Avoid dangerous areas: Stay away from places known for crime such as abandoned buildings, dark alleys, or other such places.
